pull.title: guix: build for Linux HOSTS with `-static-libgcc`
pull.body:
Build release binaries with `-static-libgcc`.
Would avoid future issues like https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/33178.

events.body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--006a51241073e994b41acfe9ec718e94-->
### Code Coverage & Benchmarks
For details see: https://corecheck.dev/bitcoin/bitcoin/pulls/33181.
<!--021abf342d371248e50ceaed478a90ca-->
### Reviews

| Type | Reviewers |
| ---- | --------- |
| Concept ACK | [theuni](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/33181#issuecomment-3201253439), [willcl-ark](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/33181#pullrequestreview-3347122839) |

If your review is incorrectly listed, please react with ðŸ‘Ž to this comment and the bot will ignore it on the next update.
<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#33537](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/33537) ([wip] A more static bitcoin-qt by fanquake)
* [#25573](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25573) ([POC] guix: produce a fully `-static-pie` bitcoind by fanquake)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.
<!--5faf32d7da4f0f540f40219e4f7537a3-->

Concept ACK.

But note that this may require some care when we start shipping the kernel, as it likely needs to be built against a shared libgcc (and maybe libstdc++, depending on what our api/abi looks like at that point).

Maybe add a note so we don't forget?

> Maybe add a note so we don't forget?

Any preference to where we add that?
@theuni switched this to using `CMAKE_EXE_LINKER_FLAGS`, which should make it clearer which flags are being used for executables.

Switching to `CMAKE_EXE_LINKER_FLAGS` came out of an offline discussion with fanquake.

@fanquake we want all flags passed to all binaries with the exception of `-static-libstdc++ -static-libgcc`, which should only go to exe's.

So I think we want:
`HOST_LDFLAGS="-Wl,--as-needed -Wl,--dynamic-linker=$glibc_dynamic_linker -Wl,-O2"`
`CMAKE_EXE_LINKER_FLAGS="-static-libstdc++ -static-libgcc"`

Then for CMake, still pass `LDFLAGS` via `HOST_LDFLAGS` in addition to `CMAKE_EXE_LINKER_FLAGS`. That way exe's will (should?) end up with both.
Yea, I need to rework this in any case, as the macOS build breaks with the changes here.

verification.payload:
tree f3a597a66fb4ae5eeaef9d9248ebadd9047c3caa
parent 64a7c7cbb975cb3c3f25a3f784779f32cd95ebaa

guix: move static-libc++ into CMAKE_EXE_LINKER_FLAGS flags

Make it clearer that we are only applying this to executables.

events.message:
guix: move static-libc++ into CMAKE_EXE_LINKER_FLAGS flags

Make it clearer that we are only applying this to executables.

verification.payload:
tree fcb19a0490d30779b5547f9c12cff3bc632cf08d
parent 0725592ebae0dd85e7dbd73c59a37a6e3217da42
author fanquake <fanquake@gmail.com> 1755010988 +0100
committer fanquake <fanquake@gmail.com> 1760371548 +0100

guix: build for Linux HOSTS with -static-libgcc

events.message: guix: build for Linux HOSTS with -static-libgcc

comments.body: Hmm, is it necessary for `CMAKE_EXE_LINKER_FLAGS` to also contain `HOST_LDFLAGS`? I would have expected CMake to use both for exe's.
I couldn't find a way to pass these through, without it, without the build breaking in one way or another.

I think this is expected, from reading the docs on [LDFLAGS](https://cmake.org/cmake/help/latest/envvar/LDFLAGS.html), [CMAKE_EXE_LINKER_FLAGS](https://cmake.org/cmake/help/latest/variable/CMAKE_EXE_LINKER_FLAGS_CONFIG.html) and [CMAKE_SHARED_LINKER_FLAGS](https://cmake.org/cmake/help/latest/variable/CMAKE_SHARED_LINKER_FLAGS.html):

>For any configuration run (including the first), the environment variable (LDFLAGS) will be ignored if the equivalent CMAKE_<TYPE>_LINKER_FLAGS_INIT variable is defined.

In reading it occurred to me that we might make the intent here even clearer (and more cmake-native) by using those terms ourselves with a patch:

<details>
<summary>Details</summary>

```patch
commit 98d944d0027e27ea76de9cca5de2fd8b2385e9a3
Author: will <will@256k1.dev>
Date:   Thu Oct 16 21:59:34 2025 +0100

    fixup! guix: move static-libc++ into CMAKE_EXE_LINKER_FLAGS flags

diff --git a/contrib/guix/libexec/build.sh b/contrib/guix/libexec/build.sh
index 221006f403b..fdfe47f26f3 100755
--- a/contrib/guix/libexec/build.sh
+++ b/contrib/guix/libexec/build.sh
@@ -225,13 +225,13 @@ esac
 
 # LDFLAGS
 case "$HOST" in
-    *linux*)  HOST_LDFLAGS="-Wl,--as-needed -Wl,--dynamic-linker=$glibc_dynamic_linker -Wl,-O2" ;;
-    *mingw*)  HOST_LDFLAGS="-Wl,--no-insert-timestamp" ;;
+    *linux*)  HOST_SHARED_LINKER_FLAGS="-Wl,--as-needed -Wl,--dynamic-linker=$glibc_dynamic_linker -Wl,-O2" ;;
+    *mingw*)  HOST_SHARED_LINKER_FLAGS="-Wl,--no-insert-timestamp" ;;
 esac
 
 # EXE FLAGS
 case "$HOST" in
-    *linux*)  CMAKE_EXE_LINKER_FLAGS="-DCMAKE_EXE_LINKER_FLAGS=${HOST_LDFLAGS} -static-libstdc++ -static-libgcc" ;;
+    *linux*)  HOST_EXE_LINKER_FLAGS="${HOST_SHARED_LINKER_FLAGS} -static-libstdc++ -static-libgcc" ;;
 esac
 
 mkdir -p "$DISTSRC"
@@ -243,13 +243,14 @@ mkdir -p "$DISTSRC"
 
     # Configure this DISTSRC for $HOST
     # shellcheck disable=SC2086
-    env CFLAGS="${HOST_CFLAGS}" CXXFLAGS="${HOST_CXXFLAGS}" LDFLAGS="${HOST_LDFLAGS}" \
+    env CFLAGS="${HOST_CFLAGS}" CXXFLAGS="${HOST_CXXFLAGS}" \
     cmake -S . -B build \
           --toolchain "${BASEPREFIX}/${HOST}/toolchain.cmake" \
           -DWITH_CCACHE=OFF \
           -Werror=dev \
           ${CONFIGFLAGS} \
-          "${CMAKE_EXE_LINKER_FLAGS}"
+          -DCMAKE_SHARED_LINKER_FLAGS="${HOST_SHARED_LINKER_FLAGS}" \
+          -DCMAKE_EXE_LINKER_FLAGS="${HOST_EXE_LINKER_FLAGS}"

 
     # Build Bitcoin Core
     cmake --build build -j "$JOBS" ${V:+--verbose}
```

</details>

...resulting in code:

```sh
# LDFLAGS
case "$HOST" in
    *linux*)  HOST_SHARED_LINKER_FLAGS="-Wl,--as-needed -Wl,--dynamic-linker=$glibc_dynamic_linker -Wl,-O2" ;;
    *mingw*)  HOST_SHARED_LINKER_FLAGS="-Wl,--no-insert-timestamp" ;;
esac

# EXE FLAGS
case "$HOST" in
    *linux*)  HOST_EXE_LINKER_FLAGS="${HOST_SHARED_LINKER_FLAGS} -static-libstdc++ -static-libgcc" ;;
esac

mkdir -p "$DISTSRC"
(
    cd "$DISTSRC"

    # Extract the source tarball
    tar --strip-components=1 -xf "${GIT_ARCHIVE}"

    # Configure this DISTSRC for $HOST
    # shellcheck disable=SC2086
    env CFLAGS="${HOST_CFLAGS}" CXXFLAGS="${HOST_CXXFLAGS}" \
    cmake -S . -B build \
          --toolchain "${BASEPREFIX}/${HOST}/toolchain.cmake" \
          -DWITH_CCACHE=OFF \
          -Werror=dev \
          ${CONFIGFLAGS}
          -DCMAKE_SHARED_LINKER_FLAGS="${HOST_SHARED_LINKER_FLAGS}" \
          -DCMAKE_EXE_LINKER_FLAGS="${HOST_EXE_LINKER_FLAGS}"

```

IMO this makes it even clearer which flags are for shared libraries and which are for executables. Passing them in explicitly via `-DCMAKE_*_*` as arguments gives them the highest precedence and ensures the toolchain doesnt' interfere with them (which happened to me in testing).
